main event: Two witnesses in Clarkston, Michigan reported a single bright light in the sky, moving rapidly from north to southeast in November 1959.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 1-2 minutes before the light disappeared from sight.
The report was received by telephone from Mrs. Evelyn Becker and her neighbor, Mrs. Mary Smith.
The Air Force could find no explanation for this aerial sighting at the time of the report.
The document mentions that there was 1 photo included, although no photo is visible in the image.
The details about the altitude and size of the light were unknown.
sighted object: a single bright light in the sky
witnesses: Mrs. Evelyn Becker and Mrs. Mary Smith
photographs: no visible photograph in the document
